metadata.feature_description: Provides adaptive user interface that works across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

steps.action: Resize browser to 1920x1080 and view PersonaBar and page content
steps.expected: PersonaBar and page content should display properly at desktop resolution
steps.actual: PersonaBar displayed on left with all icons (Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, User avatar, Edit). Navigation menu showed horizontally with all page links. Product grid displayed 4 columns. Content area was spacious and well-laid out.

steps.action: Open Content panel at desktop resolution
steps.expected: Panel should open with proper spacing and layout
steps.actual: Content > Assets panel opened with good spacing. Submenu items (Assets, Pages, Forms, Content Library, Recycle Bin) displayed clearly. Folder cards (My Website, Test Portal) showed side by side with adequate padding.

steps.action: Resize browser to 768x1024 (tablet portrait) and view PersonaBar panel
steps.expected: PersonaBar panel should adapt to narrower viewport
steps.actual: PersonaBar remained fixed-width on left side. Assets panel adapted to narrower viewport with folder cards displayed properly. Content submenu remained accessible.

steps.action: View main page content at tablet viewport
steps.expected: Navigation should collapse to hamburger menu, content should adapt
steps.actual: Menu button appeared in header indicating collapsed navigation. PersonaBar remained visible. Hero section text wrapped appropriately. Product grid showed 2 columns. Trial notification wrapped to fit width.

steps.action: Resize browser to 375x667 (mobile portrait) and view UI
steps.expected: UI should adapt to mobile viewport with PersonaBar and content adjusting
steps.actual: PersonaBar remained fixed-width (~80px) on left side, reducing content area. Menu button visible for collapsed navigation. Hero section text wrapped properly. Learn More button spanned content width. All text remained readable.

steps.action: Resize browser to 667x375 (mobile landscape) and view UI
steps.expected: UI should adapt to landscape orientation
steps.actual: PersonaBar showed partial icons due to limited height (Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics visible). Menu button remained accessible. Search bar took full width. Hero section text displayed better horizontally. More content visible in landscape.

steps.action: Resize browser to 1024x768 (tablet landscape) and view UI
steps.expected: UI should display more content in landscape mode
steps.actual: PersonaBar visible with all icons. Menu button still present (navigation collapsed at this breakpoint). Product grid showed 3 columns. Hero section displayed well. More horizontal content visible.

steps.action: Click Menu button to expand collapsed navigation
steps.expected: Navigation menu should expand showing all page links
steps.actual: Dropdown menu expanded displaying all navigation links vertically (HOME, OUR PRODUCTS, NEWS, COMMUNITY, etc.). Items with subpages showed arrows indicating expandable menus. Full-width dropdown overlay provided easy selection.

steps.expected: UI should be at tablet breakpoint with collapsed navigation
steps.actual: Menu button visible indicating navigation collapsed. PersonaBar displayed with all icons. Content adapted to narrower viewport. Layout remained intact without overflow.

steps.action: Test at 1025px viewport width (just above tablet breakpoint)
steps.expected: UI should show tablet/desktop transition behavior
steps.actual: Menu button still visible at this width (theme breakpoint is higher than 1024px). PersonaBar displayed correctly. Product grid showed 3 columns. Content adapted well.

steps.action: Apply 150% browser zoom and view UI
steps.expected: UI should scale properly without layout issues or overflow
steps.actual: PersonaBar icons scaled larger and remained visible. Content area zoomed in with less content visible. Hero section text was larger. Layout remained intact without horizontal overflow. All elements remained usable.

steps.action: Apply 75% browser zoom and view UI
steps.expected: UI should scale down and show more content
steps.actual: More content visible on screen. All 8 product categories visible (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS, HOME THEATERS, BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, CAMERAS). PersonaBar icons smaller but still functional. Layout remained intact without issues.

observations: PersonaBar does NOT collapse on mobile/tablet viewports - it remains fixed at approximately 80px width, which reduces content area on small screens. This is a design decision to ensure admin functionality is always accessible.
The website theme's navigation collapses to a hamburger menu at viewports narrower than approximately 1100px, not at the CSS media query breakpoint of 1024px.
CSS media queries found in code: min-height: 620px for positioning user avatar, and min-device-width: 768px / max-device-width: 1024px for tablet-specific styles.
JavaScript in evoq.js references breakpoints at 1024px and 768px for social tasks positioning, but this code is disabled (task bar hidden per CONTENT-8436).
The PersonaBar panel animations and hover interactions work consistently across all viewport sizes.
